title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 58-2.19 - Records to be kept when derivatives are infused
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 58-2.19 - Records to be kept when derivatives are infused

State Regulations

The following information shall be included on the recipient's chart or in records maintained in the blood bank or pharmacy: (a) product name, manufacturer, lot number, and expiration date; (b) documentation of visual inspection prior to infusion; (c) name of person administering the product; (d) documentation of identification of the recipient; (e) date of infusion and quantity of material infused; and
(f) description of any adverse reaction and the results of related investigation. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10

58-2.19

New

York State Register July 29, 2015/Volume XXXVII, Issue 30, eff. 9/27/2015

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
